item.title: Sofia add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "Reader, I married him." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Sofia add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "In vain have I struggled. It will not do. My feelings will not be repressed. You must allow me to tell you how ardently I admire and love you." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Sofia add a quote by Arthur C. Clarke
item.description: "Two possibilities exist: either we are alone in the Universe or we are not. Both are equally terrifying." -- Arthur C. Clarke

item.title: Sofia add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "If the real world were a book, it would never find a publisher. Overlong, detailed to the point of distraction-and ultimately, without a major resolution." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Sofia add a quote by Daphne du Maurier
item.description: "But luxury has never appealed to me, I like simple things, books, being alone, or with somebody who understands." -- Daphne du Maurier

item.title: Sofia add a quote by Rachel Carson
item.description: "The more clearly we can focus our attention on the wonders and realities of the universe about us, the less taste we shall have for destruction." -- Rachel Carson

item.title: Sofia add a quote by Edith Wharton
item.description: "My little old dog a heart-beat at my feet" -- Edith Wharton

item.title: Sofia add a quote by James Fenimore Cooper
item.description: "History, like love, is so apt to surround her heroes with an atmosphere of imaginary brightness." -- James Fenimore Cooper

item.title: Sofia add a quote by Thich Nhat Hanh
item.description: "Walk as if you are kissing the Earth with your feet." -- Thich Nhat Hanh

item.title: Sofia add a quote by Diana Gabaldon
item.description: "I stood still, vision blurring, and in that moment, I heard my heart break. It was a small, clean sound, like the snapping of a flower's stem." -- Diana Gabaldon

item.title: Sofia add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "The past is obdurate." -- Stephen King

item.title: Sofia add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "Yes, and imagine a world where there were no hypothetical situations." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Sofia add a quote by Stephen Hawking
item.description: "If time travel is possible, where are the tourists from the future?" -- Stephen Hawking

item.title: Sofia add a quote by Richard Lovelace
item.description: "Stone walls do not a prison make, Nor iron bars a cage; Minds innocent and quiet take That for an hermitage; If I have freedom in my love And in my soul am free, Angels alone that soar above, Enjoy such liberty." -- Richard Lovelace

item.title: Sofia add a quote by Charlotte Bronte
item.description: "I believe in some blending of hope and sunshine sweetening the worst lots. I believe that this life is not all; neither the beginning nor the end. I believe while I tremble; I trust while I weep." -- Charlotte Bronte

item.title: Sofia add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "I thought I loved him when he went away; I love him now in another degree: he is more my own. [ . . . ] Oh! a thousand weepers, praying in agony on waiting shores, listened for that voice, but it was not uttered--not uttered till; when the hush came, some could not feel it: till, when the sun returned, his light was night to some!" -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Sofia add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "Kindred spirits are not so scarce as I used to think. It's splendid to find out there are so many of them in the world." -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: Sofia add a quote by Joseph Conrad
item.description: "It's only those who do nothing that make no mistakes, I suppose." -- Joseph Conrad

item.title: Sofia add a quote by David Sedaris
item.description: "Like all of my friends, she's a lousy judge of character." -- David Sedaris

item.title: Sofia add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "I don't trust people who don't love themselves and tell me, 'I love you.' ... There is an African saying which is: Be careful when a naked person offers you a shirt." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Sofia add a quote by Julian Barnes
item.description: "How often do we tell our own life story? How often do we adjust, embellish, make sly cuts? And the longer life goes on, the fewer are those around to challenge our account, to remind us that our life is not our life, merely the story we have told about our life. Told to others, but&mdash;mainly&mdash;to ourselves." -- Julian Barnes

item.title: Sofia add a quote by Julian Barnes
item.description: "History is that certainty produced at the point where the imperfections of memory meet the inadequacies of documentation." -- Julian Barnes

item.title: Sofia add a quote by Julian Barnes
item.description: "What you end up remembering isn't always the same as what you have witnessed." -- Julian Barnes

item.title: Sofia add a quote by Julian Barnes
item.description: "It strikes me that this may be one of the differences between youth and age: when we are young, we invent different futures for ourselves; when we are old, we invent different pasts for others." -- Julian Barnes
